page.title: 14BLACKMORE VALE DAIRY FARMING
page.content: 0375/0114.Ryalls Farm consists of 205 acres of sown and fertilised grassland used for pasture or for cutting as grass silage or hay.A herd of 100 milking cows plus sixty followers are maintained here. Seven hundred pigs are also kept for fattening.The milk yield is sent to Express Dairies at Wincanton,ten miles distant.The Market at Sturminster Newton is used for sale and purchase of animals.The River Lydden forms the boundary of this farm for half a mile on the South-east. The piggery now stands on the site of the old farmhouse.A new farmhouse built twenty-five years ago is occupied by the farmer's son and his young family.The farmer and his wife live in a recently erected bungalow about one hundred yards away. There is no public transport serving this area.
